channel.title: [Class Suggestion] Messanger/Mole
channel.description:
> # [color = "steblue"] Messanger [/color] > **[color = "steblue"] Blue Dragon Social [/color]** > > Night Ability 1: Report - Get target player's feedback if their action was successful. Does not see attacks or conversions (they return unsuccessful). (Unlimited) > Night Ability 2: Message - Send a copy of your first targets feedback to your second. You do not know what the feedback was. (2 uses)
> # [color = "purple"] Mole [/color] > **[color = "purple"] Unseen Social [/color]** > > Day Ability: Audit - Target player will not get feedback from their Ability's tonight. (2 uses) > > Night Ability 1: Mislead - Target player will think their ability failed. You will know what their results would have been. (Unlimited) > Night Ability 2: Courier - Send a copy of the first targets feedback to the second. You will know what the feedback was. (2 uses)
A social class about feedback manipulation! And a bit more claimable than Hunter if you have enough information
[details = "Falure definitions"] Sheriff = NS Paladin = NS, Watched over Knight = Watched over Physician = DNR Noble = No feedback (maid returns failed) Observer = No visits/No visitors, BD Princess = Always succeeeds, Attacker Hunter = Beared and attacked. (Wolf returns successful) Prince = Always returns failed Butler = Occupy Immunity, Party returns successful Drunk = Occupy Immunity, Party returns successful CW = Did not block, Tornado returns successful MM = Convert immune target Mystic = Returns failed [/details]

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Messanger/Mole
item.dc:creator: RawkHawk
item.description:
You’re not entirely wrong that it is investigative. I think we just need to draw the line somewhere so we can have social classes with real abilities. Right now invest already has 3 bd classes, while social has 2. Not that there is anything wrong with more invest, but I think if we can reason it, invest abilities used in a “social” way are preferred.

I also think this is still a possible mm claim. The only way it wouldn’t be is if princess invests the mm, and right now, I see MMs claim physicians or knights a decent amount.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Messanger/Mole
item.dc:creator: mathmods
item.description:
Haha, Good point.
Won’t pursue this on being Investigative if people will keep telling me that it’s social.
After all, it’s up to the devs to consider this right?

(Thinking back, the original reason of me considering Messenger as invest was give MM a new throw-off when he uses foresight. Not necessary tbh.)

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Messanger/Mole
item.dc:creator: RawkHawk
item.description:
Here’s the thing though: everything is investigative. Butler occupying? He’s searching for immunities. Drunk redirect? Finding if someone is attacking. Court wizard barrier? No one attempted to occupy or convert them.

You’re not wrong that, yes he is getting information what the class does. However it has a few restrictions that the class has to actually do something. And it also has the weakness of not finding converts and being I distinguishable from converts. I.e. I follow someone and find they redirected someone. I don’t know if they are drunk or alcoholic.

Edit: I think the overall problem with social classes is that most fun abilities they could get are investigative in some way. We’ve been through multiple abilities and they’ve all been boring or too provable. Crier, decree. Both super complete do nothing abilities that mostly serve to prove the noble.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Messanger/Mole
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
That means that this disagreement is about definitions and therefor can’t go anywhere no matter how much we talk.

item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
The original user thing is semantics. If you think Gossip is social then Report is social. If you think Gossip is investigative then Report is investigative.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Messanger/Mole
item.dc:creator: mathmods
item.description:
As I stated above, I think Noble fits social because he doesn’t know who the original user was. + He also has Spy. He also needs to be lucky to find out who is being targetted.
Messenger however does not fit in with the same terminology since he literally knows exactly what response a certain player got. This fits much better in as an investigative.

Read full topic

item.description:
True, but my point still stands, The Messenger gather classes, should it really be a social?
Shouldn’t it be an Investigative?

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Messanger/Mole
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
To be fair that would make him at best as good as a Sheriff. And even then it doesn’t work for that most of the time.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Messanger/Mole
item.dc:creator: mathmods
item.description:
Reasonable, but I still think Messenger fits as Invest instead of Social since instead of knowing what other people did to your target, you now know exactly what your target did. It’s a hard-counter against all converted classess too. Just plop a messenger on them and he already knows that the person is converted. (Unless this is Servant/Invoker/Sage/Ritualist)

Socials shouldn’t be able to do that.
And for that reason it should be Investigative since they gather knowledge.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Messanger/Mole
item.dc:creator: Htm
item.description:
mathmods:

The BD version of Messenger is more of an investigative rather than social since he pulls out potential classes from someone. It’s still a pseudo-social class, but I think Investigative fits better.

But since another person gets the feedback then that’s social

so technically a pally who checked a person and another person got his results = social

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Messanger/Mole
item.dc:creator: mathmods
item.description:
Seems like a good suggestion for a new insta-exe on trial person.

And for honest opinions:
Messenger
BD Investigative

Mole
Unseen Social

The BD version of Messenger is more of an investigative rather than social since he pulls out potential classes from someone. It’s still a pseudo-social class, but I think Investigative fits better.

Mole is more of a Social though. Their abilities disrupt the end-result sort of like Fool and Scorned. They can also entirely block the end-result. A much more “Social” character than Messenger.

Read full topic
